alert.note: Alert for Harding; Quay; San Miguel (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 15 at 9:42PM MDT until July 15 at 10:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central San Miguel County in northeastern New Mexico... South central Harding County in northeastern New Mexico... Central Quay County in east central New Mexico... * Until 1045 PM MDT. * At 942 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 17 miles south of Mosquero, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tennis ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Quay, Tucumcari, Logan, San Jon, Ute Lake State Park and Bell Ranch. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 316 and 360. State Road 104 between Mile Markers 82 and 105. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: This storm is producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows!
